title: Montana Gravel Challenge
description:
MONTANA GRAVEL CHALLENGE
April 13 – 15 | Missoula, Montana
The Montana Hell Ride and The Rocky Mountain Roubaix are joining forces and presenting a multi-day gran fondo style gravel event inspired by the Spring Classics: The Montana Gravel Challenge.
The Montana Gravel Challenge is a coming together of The Cycling House and Competitive Timing.  We think what’s best for the Montana Hell Ride and Rocky Mountain Roubaix is to have them be on one big gravel weekend.  Stage 2 will be the Montana Hell Ride with a new format and course. Stage 3 will be the Rocky Mountain Roubaix with a new longer course. We’ve added a stage 1 time trial as an extra piece to offer a zero barrier event for beginners and recreational riders, while also offering racers an early separation before stage 2 and 3.  We’d like riders of all abilities to try the challenge.  It’s setup in a grand fondo style format, so everyone gets a time and folks can go for racing the event, riding the event, or just going for a completion.  Stage 2 and 3 will have a recreation wave that starts 1 minute later then the first wave perfect for those riding with friends or trying to stay out of a larger group.  The hardest part about this event will be finishing all three stages, not being fast at all three stages.
course:
Stage 1 6 time trial is all dirt roads.  It’s climbs just over 600 feet in 4 miles.  It’s more gentle terrain then straight uphill.  First 1.5 miles is low 1% grade offering a great warmup for the last 2.5 miles. You get in to really pretty forests and some super small/cool dirt roads that don’t see much life.

Stage 2 is the Montana Hell Ride.  It’s actually three 15 miles laps on a new circuit in the 9 mile area.  Each lap is a tale of two sides.  Half the lap is wide, smooth, and fast dirt roads.  The other half is hilly, rough, narrow, and adventurous.  Race or ride with your buds, should be a memorable day.  There will also be a Strava KOM every time of the climb.

Stage 3 is the Rocky Mountain Roubaix.  Longer than last year with new course for 2018 but with all the beloved Roubaix aspects still about equal parts road and dirt, moderate climbing, and a whole lotta grit.  It’s straight up your favorite Petty Creek Road and then out the 9 mile drainage with a lollipop loop and then back the way you came.
registration:
Between Jan 18th and April 12th – register for all three rides at once and receive a $10 discount.

Earn some $$ Register early and share your registration referral link on social media AND get 12 registrations you will receive an automatic $20 refund. That’s only four friends registering for the whole challenge!

Early Bird Flash Sale Three Days Only! Jan 15th – 17th

Montana Gravel Challenge All 3 Stages – $55  $60
Stage 1 – 6 Mile TT only – $5 $10 online registration
Stage 2 – Montana Hell Ride only – $25  $30 online registration
Stage 3 – Rocky Mountain Roubaix only – $25 $30 online registration
Phase 1  Jan 18th – March 18th

Montana Gravel Challenge All 3 Stages – $60 $75 (save $10 reg all three at once)
Stage 1 – 6 Mile TT only – $10 $15 online registration
Stage 2 – Montana Hell Ride only – $30  $35 online registration
Stage 3 – Rocky Mountain Roubaix only – $30  $35 online registration
Phase 2 March 19th – April 12th

Montana Gravel Challenge All 3 Stages – $75 $100 (save $10 reg all three at once)
Stage 1 – 6 Mile TT only – $15 $20 online registration
Stage 2 – Montana Hell Ride only – $35 $40 online registration
Stage 3 – Rocky Mountain Roubaix only – $35 $40 online registration
Race Weekend April 13 – 15th

Montana Gravel Challenge All 3 Stages – $100
Stage 1 – 6 Mile TT only – $20 online registration
Stage 2 – Montana Hell Ride only – $40 online registration
Stage 3 – Rocky Mountain Roubaix only – $40 online registration
You can ride only one stage if you’d like.  Lot’s of folks will just ride one of the stages.  We encourage you to push yourself and finish the challenge but it’s ok to just ride one stage.
notes:
GIVING BACK
All proceeds from the Montana Gravel Challenge will be split 50/50 between MTB Missoula and Zootown Derailleurs.  Our goal is raise $2000.

SPONSORS
Zillastate and Zillastate.com for all your real estate needs
Big Sky Brewery, keeping ups hydrated and supporting the cycling community from day 1
PRIZES
Anyone who finishes all three stages gets a commemorative long sleeve hooded t-shirt.  Top 3 overall male and female for the whole challenge will receive prize and/or medal and/or cash if turnout allows.  Top 3 in all age categories for stages and the overall top three will be recognized and receive a prize and/or medal.

CAMPING
Tent, RV, and trailer camping is available at the race venue.  Please let us know your coming if you’d like to reserve a camp spot.  If you don’t reserve it’s first come first serve.  There will be bathrooms and water on site, but nothing else.  Cell service is very poor in that specific area.

CHALLENGE SCORING
1st – 20th score.  (20, 19, 18, 17, ect)
Have to complete all three stages to qualify for overall in age group and overall.
JUNIOR EVENTS
We are excited to offer two junior tailored events to the Montana Gravel Challenge!

Juniors age 10-18 may ride in Stage 1 – 6 Mile TT and also a single lap of the of 15 mile Hell Ride Circuit. Jrs will receive a time and place. Experienced juniors may particpant and register in the adult events according to experience level.

Categories will be 10-12, 13/14, 15/16, 17/18. Top three in each category (gender separated) will be recognized and receive a prize and/or medal.

Price – $10 for each stage

Parent may ride alongside their junior.

Stage 1 – Juniors may complete the TT ride between 4 and 5 PM. Checkin will be available starting at 2:45PM. Parents may then complete their portion of the TT with the rest of the adults after the Junior event.

Stage 2- Juniors will complete 1 lap of the Hell Ride circuit. Junior event will be at 3 PM.
directions:
LOCATION – all stages and check in
18450 Six Mile Road
Huson, MT 59846

title: Unravel the Scratch Gravel

address.street: Helena BLM Scratchgravels District, Echo Dr. TH

description: Helena United Cycling bring you the annual Unravel the Scratchgravel Mtn XC race.
course: The start & finish area is located at the Echo Drive Trailhead in the BLM Scratchgravel Hills District, northwest of Helena. The course is a 5.8 mile loop, comprised of 70% double-track and 30% single track.
registration: $25 race fee. Pre-register online at http://www.usacycling.org/events/ Online registration saves you time on race day. Please ensure you e-sign the USA cycling wavier. All racers must be licensed through USA Cycling. If you do not have a USA cycling license, create an account and license at www.usacycling.org. One day licenses will also be available for $10 on race day.
notes:
9:00 to 10:30 – Registration & Check-in
11:00 -	Pro/Category 1. Full Course, Men: 5 laps (29 miles) / Women 4 laps (23.2 miles).
11:05-	Category 2 & Masters. Full Course, 3 laps (17.4 miles).
11:10-	Category 3. Full Course, 2 laps (11.6 miles)
11:15-	Juniors. Full Course, 1 lap (5.8 miles)
directions: Turn off U.S. 12 (Euclid Rd.) at Williams Avenue and continue northwest to Birdseye Road. Turn where Echo Drive intersects Birdseye Road, to your right, just past the Birdseye Store & Deli. One mile up Echo Drive is the trailhead.

title: 12 & 24 Hours of Flathead
description: A 12 & 24 Hour Mountain Bike Race located at Herron Park in Kalispell!  Two courses; adaptive bike course and non adaptive!  Race as a solo or in teams of up to 5!  For questions or comments contact us at info@24hoursofflathead.org
course: The adaptive course is roughly 2 miles and has an elevation gain of 250ft.  The non adaptive course is roughly 9 miles and 1400 ft of elevation again
registration: To registor visit the below link!  Online Registration closes at midnight on 8/17/18, but on-site registration is an option the day of the race from 7am - 9:15am.  https://runsignup.com/Race/MT/Kalispell/24HoursofFlathead
notes:
Awards for both the 12 &  Courses will be distributed on Sunday 8/19 @ 11am.  An announcement will be made 15 minutes prior to the Awards Ceremony (also includes a free lunch)

Prizes:
Medals for places 1-3
Prizes for everyone

Camping:  Camping is permitted overnight for our race!  The field is open to tents and parking lots are open to campers.  We have paid your camping fee for Saturday night.   If you choose to camp one Friday night, the fee is $10 and there is a dropbox where you can place a check or cash.
directions:
From the South: Take Old U.S. 93 E/N Orange St to I-90 W
2 min (0.5 mi)
 
Take US-93 N to MT-35 W/S Shore Rd in Lake County
1 h 9 min (66.7 mi)
 
Continue on MT-35 W to Flathead County
50 min (40.7 mi)
 
Turn right onto US-93 N
4 min (3.6 mi)
 
Follow Rocky Cliff Dr, Airport Rd and Foys Canyon Rd to Foys Lake Rd
10 min (5.5 mi)

From the North:
Follow US-93 S to Twin Bridges Rd in Flathead County
44 min (46.5 mi)
 
Take Lodgepole Rd and State Hwy 424 to Foys Lake Rd
30 min (21.0 mi)
